Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Gloryman> Fpgas are good at securing the network and they are good for the environment. I want to own an fpga. But i think they are bad for the continual growth of the vrsc community and bad because all the hash could soon be controlled by one companies bitstream. This also creates a very unstable hash rate. The white paper also states fair distribution as one of its key goals. So, at this stage of the project I think they should be banned and the currency forked. They are potentially stopping hundreds of thousands of casual miners and vrsc uses, to give close to 100% of pow coins to a few thousand fpga miner if they don't stop it.

Author: actionslacks#4072
Content: the exact same argument has been and will be made after every advance in mining tech. fpga's were on the scene before asics many years ago.  It could be possible that asics will be created in the future to usurp the current fpga's or even the code to obsolete them. This is a microcosm of the march of progress in semiconductor design. there is no easy answer. but embracing and utilizing progress has more often than not been conducive to survival.
